greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of directed graphs of n vertices with more than 1 component and out degree = 1.
comment: a(n) gives the number of unique ways a directed graph of n vertices with out degree 1 can be broken into smaller components of size >= 2. It can be generalized to higher degree by replacing A329426 in the formula with a suitable counting function.
link: Stephen Dunn, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..100
example: a(4) = A329426(2)*A329426(2) = 1*1 = 1, which represents the graph
a(5) = A329426(2)*A329426(3) = 1*2 = 2, which represents the two possible graphs of size 3 (V --> V <--> V, etc.) paired with V <--> V.
program: fun A056542(n: Long): Long = if (n == 1L) 0 else n * A056542(n-1) + 1
fun a(n: Long): Long = (2L..(n/2)).map { A329426(it) * A329426(n-it) }.sum()
results.author: _Stephen Dunn_, Nov 30 2019
